channel.title: Posts on ICERM Generative Models Discussion Group
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on ICERM Generative Models Discussion Group

item.title: Overview of Deep Generative Models
item.description: Summary This week Stannis gave a high-level overview of three popular families of deep generative models. The discussion is mainly based on the original papers [1][2]. The goal is to point out the commonalities and differences between these models, and have a detailed discussion on the different learning methods employed by these models. Overview When using latent variable models for probabilistic modeling, the objects of interest are the latent variables (which we denote by $z$), and the observed variables (which we denote by $x$).

item.title: Tutorial on Probabilistic Programming
item.description: On Thursday 2019-02-28 from 10 am to 11 am, Prof. Daniel Ritchie gave a tutorial on probabilistic programming in the 11th floor lecture hall at ICERM. The slides are available online. A blog post with a summary would be available later.
